analyzed: milindapañha

original: Meṇḍakapañha
analyzed: meṇḍakapañha

original: Abhejjavagga

original: 3. Maccubhāyanābhāyanapañha
analyzed: maccubhāyana ābhāyana pañha
translated: The Questions of Macchariya and Bhaddanta

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “Venerable Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti, puna bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā ti puna bhaṇita
translated: ‘All are afraid of punishment, all are afraid of death.’ Again it is said:

original: ‘arahā sabbabhayamatikkanto’ti.
analyzed: arahā sabba bhayam atikkanto ti
translated: ‘The Worthy One has gone beyond all fear.’

original: Kiṁ nu kho, bhante nāgasena, arahā daṇḍabhayā tasati, niraye vā nerayikā sattā jalitā kuthitā tattā santattā tamhā jalitaggijālakā mahānirayā cavamānā maccuno bhāyanti.
analyzed: kim nu kho bhante nāgasena arahā daṇḍa bhayā tasati niraye vā nerayikā sattā jalitā kuthitā tattā santattā tamhā jalita ggi jālakā mahānirayā cavamānā maccunaḥ bhāyanti
translated: Now, does the Worthy One fear punishment or do the beings in hell, when they are being carried out of the Great Hell of Ultimate Torment, blazing, burning, enveloped in flames, fear death?

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: If, revered Nāgasena, it was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti, tena hi ‘arahā sabbabhayamatikkanto’ti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā ti tena hi arahā sabba bhayam atikkanto ti yam tam micchā
translated: ‘All are afraid of punishment, all are afraid of death,’ then the statement that ‘the Worthy One has gone beyond all fear’ is wrong.

original: Yadi bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: If it was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘arahā sabbabhayamatikkanto’ti, tena hi ‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: arahā sabba bhayam atikkanto ti tena hi sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā ti tat pi vacanam micchā
translated: ‘The Worthy One has gone beyond all fear,’ then the statement that ‘all are afraid of punishment, all are afraid of death’ is wrong.

original: Ayaṁ ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This is a double-pronged question that has come to you. You should resolve it.”

original: “Netaṁ, mahārāja, vacanaṁ bhagavatā arahante upādāya bhaṇitaṁ—🔽‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti.
analyzed: neta mahā rāja vacanam bhagavatā arahante upādāya bhaṇita  sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā iti
translated: “Great king, that statement was not made by the Blessed One with reference to arahants.🔽‘All tremble at violence; all fear death.

original: Ṭhapito arahā tasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ, samūhato bhayahetu arahato.
analyzed: ṭhapitaḥ arahā tasmim vatthusmi samūhataḥ bhaya hetu
translated: Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.’🔽Great king, the statement ‘All tremble at violence; all fear death’ was made by the Blessed One with reference to those beings who are still stained by lust, hatred, and delusion, whose minds are not free from passion, who are bound by the bondage of defilements, and who are subject to the control of others.

original: Ye te, mahārāja, sattā sakilesā, yesañca adhimattā attānudiṭṭhi, ye ca sukhadukkhesu unnatāvanatā, te upādāya bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: ye te mahā rāja sattā sa kilesāḥ yesam ca adhimattā attā anudiṭṭhi ye ca sukha dukkhesu unnatā avanatā te upādāya bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: With reference to those arahants whose effluents are ended, whose minds are free from passion, who have reached fulfillment, the supreme state of rest, and who have gone beyond all bonds of existence, the Blessed One declared:

original: ‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti.
analyzed: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā iti
translated: ‘The arahant trembles not; he fears not death.’

original: Arahato, mahārāja, sabbagati upacchinnā, yoni viddhaṁsitā, paṭisandhi upahatā, bhaggā🔽phāsukā, samūhatā sabbabhavālayā, samucchinnā sabbasaṅkhārā, hataṁ kusalākusalaṁ,
analyzed: arahataḥ mahā rāja sabba gati upacchinnā yoni viddha sitā paṭisandhi upahatā bhaggā  phāsukā samūha tā sabba bhava ālayā samucchinnā sabba saṅkhārā hatam kusala akusala
translated: Great king, the arahant has cut off all destinations, destroyed the plane of existence, abolished the possibility of rebirth,🔽broken the chain of existence, and demolished the abode of existence. He has destroyed the root of all suffering. He has uprooted the cause of suffering.

original: vihatā avijjā, abījaṁ viññāṇaṁ kataṁ, daḍḍhā sabbakilesā, ativattā lokadhammā, tasmā
analyzed: vihatāḥ avijjāḥ abījam viññāṇam daḍḍhā sabba kilesā ativattā loka dhammā tasmā
translated: He has cut off the fetter and removed the burden. He has attained Nibbana. He has no fear of death.

original: arahā na tasati sabbabhayehi.
analyzed: arahā na tasati sabba bhayehi
translated: the arahant is not afraid of any fear.

original: Idha, mahārāja, rañño cattāro mahāmattā bhaveyyuṁ anurakkhā laddhayasā vissāsikā ṭhapitā mahati issariye ṭhāne.
analyzed: idha mahā rāja rañño cattāraḥ mahāmattāḥ bhaveyyuṃ anurakkhā laddha yasā vissāsikā ṭhapitā mahati issariye ṭhāne
translated: Suppose, sire, a king had four ministers who were loyal, who had been tested, who were trusted, and who had been appointed to high office.

original: Atha rājā kismiñci deva karaṇīye samuppanne yāvatā sakavijite sabbajanassa āṇāpeyya ‘sabbeva me baliṁ karontu, sādhetha tumhe cattāro mahāmattā taṁ karaṇīyan’ti.
analyzed: atha rājā kismiñci deva karaṇīye samuppanne yāvatā saka vijite sabba janassa āṇāpeyya sabbe iva me balim karontu sādhetha tumhe cattāraḥ mahāmattā tam karaṇīyanti
translated: Then, if the king had some matter to be done, he would summon all the people of his realm and say: ‘Let all of you pay me tribute. You four ministers, get on with that matter.’

original: Api nu kho, mahārāja, tesaṁ catunnaṁ mahāmattānaṁ balibhayā santāso uppajjeyyā”ti?
analyzed: api nu khalu mahā rāja tesam catunnam mahāmattānam bali bhayā santāsaḥ uppajjeyya ati
translated: Now, would fear and trembling arise in those four ministers because of the tribute?”

original: “Na hi, bhante”ti.🔽“Kena kāraṇena, mahārājā”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhantā iti  kena kāraṇena mahā rājā ati
translated: “No, revered sir.”🔽“Why not, sire?”

original: “Ṭhapitā te, bhante, raññā uttamaṭṭhāne, natthi tesaṁ bali, samatikkantabalino te, avasese upādāya raññā āṇāpitaṁ ‘sabbeva me baliṁ karontū’”ti.
analyzed: ṭhapitā te bhante raññā uttama ṭṭhāne natthi tesam bali samatikkanta balino te avasese upādāya raññā āṇāpitam sabbe iva me balim karontu uti
translated: “They have been appointed by the king to the highest office, they are beyond tribute, they have been passed over in the tribute, and the king has ordered the tribute to be paid by the rest.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, netaṁ vacanaṁ bhagavatā arahante upādāya bhaṇitaṁ, ṭhapito
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja na itam vacanam bhagavatā arahante upādāya bhaṇita
translated: “Even so, sire, this statement was not made by the Blessed One in reference to the arahant. He has been passed over in the tribute of merit.

original: arahā tasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ, samūhato bhayahetu arahato, ye te, mahārāja, sattā sakilesā,
analyzed: arahā tasmim vatthusmi samūhataḥ bhaya hetu ye te mahā rāja sattā sa kilesā
translated: The Arahat is free from fear in this matter, because he has destroyed fear.🔽But, sire, the Blessed One spoke thus with reference to those beings who are still subject to the defilements,

original: yesañca adhimattā attānudiṭṭhi, ye ca sukhadukkhesu unnatāvanatā, te upādāya bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—🔽‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti.
analyzed: yesam ca adhimattā attā anudiṭṭhi ye ca sukha dukkhesu unnatā avanatā te upādāya bhagavatā bhaṇita  sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā iti
translated: and to those who have a strong belief in a self, and who are elated or depressed by pleasure or pain.

original: Tasmā arahā na tasati sabbabhayehī”ti.
analyzed: tasmai arahā na tasati sabba bhayehi iti
translated: Therefore the Arahat is not afraid of any fear.”

original: “Netaṁ, bhante nāgasena, vacanaṁ sāvasesaṁ, niravasesavacanametaṁ ‘sabbe’ti.
analyzed: na ita bhante nāgasena vacanam sa avasesa niravasesa vacanam etam sabba iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, that statement is not complete, it is incomplete. The word ‘all’ is not complete.

original: Tattha me uttariṁ kāraṇaṁ brūhi taṁ vacanaṁ patiṭṭhāpetun”ti.
analyzed: tattha me uttarim kāraṇam brūhi tam vacanam patiṭṭhāpetunti
translated: Give me a further reason to establish that statement.”

original: “Idha, mahārāja, gāme gāmassāmiko āṇāpakaṁ āṇāpeyya ‘ehi, bho āṇāpaka, yāvatā gāme gāmikā, te sabbe sīghaṁ mama santike sannipātehī’ti.
analyzed: idha mahā rāja gāme gāma sāmikaḥ āṇāpakam āṇāpeyya ehi bho āṇāpaka yāvatā gāme gāmikā te sabbe sīgham mama santike sannipātehi iti
translated: “Suppose, sire, the lord of a village were to summon a messenger and say to him: ‘Come, good messenger, quickly assemble all the villagers in my presence.’

original: So ‘sādhu, sāmī’ti sampaṭicchitvā gāmamajjhe ṭhatvā tikkhattuṁ saddamanussāveyya ‘yāvatā gāme gāmikā, te sabbe sīghasīghaṁ sāmino santike sannipatantū’ti.
analyzed: saḥ sādhu sāmi iti sampaṭicchitvā gāma majjhe ṭhatvā tikkhattum saddam anussāveyya yāvatā gāme gāmikā te sabbe sīghasīgham sāmino santike sannipatantu uti
translated: ‘Very good, sir’, he replies, and standing in the middle of the village he causes a proclamation to be made three times: ‘Let all the villagers come quickly to their master.’

original: Tato te gāmikā āṇāpakassa vacanena turitaturitā sannipatitvā gāmassāmikassa ārocenti ‘sannipatitā, sāmi, sabbe gāmikā, yaṁ te karaṇīyaṁ taṁ karohī’ti.
analyzed: tatas te gāmikāḥ āṇāpakassa vacanena turita turitā sannipatitvā gāma ssāmikassa ārocenti sannipatitā sāmi sabbe gāmikāḥ yam te karaṇīyam tam karohi iti
translated: Then those villagers, at the word of the messenger, quickly assemble and report to the master of the village: ‘We have assembled, sir, all the villagers. Do what you have to do.’

original: Iti so, mahārāja, gāmassāmiko kuṭipurise sannipātento sabbe gāmike āṇāpeti, te ca
analyzed: iti saḥ mahā rāja gāma sāmikaḥ kuṭi purise sannipātento sabbe gāmike āṇāpeti te ca
translated: Thus, sire, that master of the village, in assembling the people of the village, orders all the villagers, and they

original: āṇattā na sabbe sannipatanti, kuṭipurisāyeva sannipatanti, ‘ettakāyeva me gāmikā’ti
analyzed: āṇattāḥ na sabbe sannipatanti kuṭi purisāya iva sannipatanti ettakāya iva me gāmikā ati
translated: being ordered do not all assemble, only the people of the village assemble. ‘Only these are my villagers’,

original: gāmassāmiko ca tathā sampaṭicchati, aññe bahutarā anāgatā itthipurisā dāsidāsā bhatakā
analyzed: gāma ssāmiko ca tathā sampaṭicchati aññe bahutarāḥ anāgatāḥ itthi purisāḥ dāsi dāsāḥ bhatakā
translated: and the master of the village agrees, and others, many more, who have not come, men and women, slaves, servants,

original: kammakarā gāmikā gilānā gomahiṁsā ajeḷakā suvānā, ye anāgatā, sabbe te agaṇitā, kuṭipuriseyeva
analyzed: kammakarā gāmikā gilānā gomahisā ajeḷakā suvānā ye anāgatā sabbe te agaṇitā
translated: hired men, workmen, villagers, the sick, cattle, buffaloes, goats, sheep, poultry, those who have not come, all these are not counted, only the people of the village

original: upādāya āṇāpitattā ‘sabbe sannipatantū’ti.
analyzed: upādāya āṇāpita ttā sabbe sannipatantu uti
translated: are counted, because they were ordered to come, ‘Let all assemble.’

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, netaṁ vacanaṁ bhagavatā arahante upādāya bhaṇitaṁ, ṭhapito
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja na itam vacanam bhagavatā arahante upādāya bhaṇita
translated: In the same way, sire, this statement was not made by the Blessed One with reference to the arahat,

original: arahā tasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ, samūhato bhayahetu arahato, ye te, mahārāja, sattā sakilesā,
analyzed: arahā tasmim vatthusmi samūhataḥ bhaya hetu ye te mahā rāja sattā sa kilesā
translated: the arahat was excluded from this matter, the arahat was removed as a reason for fear. Those beings, sire, who are still subject to the corruptions,

original: yesañca adhimattā attānudiṭṭhi, ye ca sukhadukkhesu unnatāvanatā, te upādāya bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yesam ca adhimattā attā anudiṭṭhi ye ca sukha dukkhesu unnatā avanatā te upādāya bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: and those who have a strong belief in a self, and those who are elated or depressed by pleasure or pain, it was with reference to them that the Blessed One said:

original: ‘sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno’ti.
analyzed: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa sabbe bhāyanti maccunā iti
translated: ‘All are afraid of the rod, all are afraid of death.’

original: Tasmā arahā na tasati sabbabhayehi.
analyzed: tasmai arahā na tasati sabba bhayehi
translated: Therefore the arahat is not afraid of any fear.

original: Atthi, mahārāja, sāvasesaṁ vacanaṁ sāvaseso attho, atthi sāvasesaṁ vacanaṁ niravaseso attho, atthi niravasesaṁ vacanaṁ sāvaseso attho, atthi niravasesaṁ vacanaṁ niravaseso attho.
analyzed: atthi mahā rāja sa avasesam vacanam sa avasesaḥ atthaḥ atthi sa avasesam vacanam niravasesaḥ atthaḥ atthi niravasesam vacanam sa avasesaḥ atthaḥ atthi niravasesam vacanam sa avasesaḥ atthaḥ atthi niravasesam vacanam niravasesaḥ atthaḥ
translated: There is, sire, a statement that is incomplete and the meaning is incomplete, there is a statement that is incomplete and the meaning is complete, there is a statement that is complete and the meaning is incomplete, there is a statement that is complete and the meaning is complete.

original: Tena tena attho sampaṭicchitabbo.
analyzed: tena tena atthaḥ sampaṭicchitabbo
translated: The meaning should be accepted according to each case.

original: Pañcavidhehi, mahārāja, kāraṇehi attho sampaṭicchitabbo āhaccapadena rasena ācariyavaṁsena adhippāyā kāraṇuttariyatāya.
analyzed: pañcavidhehi mahā rāja kāraṇehi atthaḥ sampaṭicchitabbaḥ āhacca padena rasena ācariya vasena adhippāyā kāraṇuttariya tāya
translated: The meaning should be accepted, sire, for five reasons: by the words spoken, by the meaning, by the tradition of the teachers, by the intention, by the transcending of the reason.

original: Ettha hi āhaccapadanti suttaṁ adhippetaṁ.🔽Rasoti suttānulomaṁ.
analyzed: ettha hi āhacca padam ti suttam adhippeta  raso ti sutta anuloma
translated: For here the word “scripture” is intended to mean the Thread,🔽“Meaning” the Thread’s province,

original: Ācariyavaṁsoti ācariyavādo.
analyzed: ācariya vaso ti ācariya vādo
translated: “Lineage” the teachers’ doctrine,

original: Adhippāyoti attano mati.
analyzed: adhippāyo ti attanaḥ mati
translated: “Intention” one’s own opinion,

original: Kāraṇuttariyatāti imehi catūhi samentaṁ kāraṇaṁ.
analyzed: imehi catūhi
translated: “Reason” the reason that is beyond the four kinds of reasons.

original: Imehi kho, mahārāja, pañcahi kāraṇehi attho sampaṭicchitabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho mahā rāja pañcahi kāraṇehi atthaḥ sampaṭicchitabbaḥ
translated: “Sire, these are the five reasons for accepting a meaning.

original: Evameso pañho suvinicchito hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam eso pañhaḥ su vinicchitaḥ hoti iti
translated: So this question is well analysed”.

original: “Hotu, bhante nāgasena, tathā taṁ sampaṭicchāmi.
analyzed: hotu bhante nāgasena tathā tam sampaṭicchāmi
translated: “Let it be, revered Nāgasena, I accept it thus.

original: Ṭhapito hotu arahā tasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ, tasantu avasesā sattā, niraye pana nerayikā
analyzed: ṭhapitaḥ hotu arahā tasmim vatthusmi tasantu avasesā sattā niraye pana nerayikā
translated: Let the Elder be acquitted on this matter, and let the rest of the creatures be at rest. But the creatures in hell,

original: sattā dukkhā tibbā kaṭukā vedanā vedayamānā jalitapajjalitasabbaṅgapaccaṅgā ruṇṇakāruññakanditaparidevitalālappitamukhā
analyzed: sattā dukkhā tibbā kaṭukā vedanāḥ vedayamānāḥ jalita pajjalita sabbaṅga paccaṅgāḥ ruṇṇa kāruñña kandita paridevita lālappita mukhāḥ
translated: revered sir, are experiencing painful, racking, piercing feelings, their whole bodies are ablaze, they are crying out, wailing, lamenting, weeping and tearing their hair,

original: asayhatibbadukkhābhibhūtā atāṇā asaraṇā asaraṇībhūtā anappasokāturā antimapacchimagatikā
analyzed: a sayha tibba dukkha abhibhūtā a tāṇā a saraṇā a saraṇībhūtā anappasoka āturā antima pacchima gatikā
translated: they are overcome by extreme, bitter, racking pain, they have no saviour, no protector, no refuge, no recourse, no shelter, no support, they are utterly helpless, they have gone to their last and worst extreme,

original: ekantasokaparāyaṇā uṇhatikhiṇacaṇḍakharatapanatejavanto bhīmabhayajanakaninādamahāsaddā
analyzed: ekanta soka parāyaṇāḥ uṇha tikhiṇa caṇḍa khara tapana tejavantaḥ bhīma bhaya janaka nināda mahā saddāḥ
translated: they are utterly devoted to sorrow, they are burning with heat, sharp, violent, harsh, flaming, intense fire, and they are making a great noise that strikes terror and causes fear.

original: saṁsibbitachabbidhajālāmālākulā samantā satayojanānupharaṇaccivegā kadariyā tapanā
analyzed: samantā kadariyā tapanā
translated: the Great Hell, which is covered with a net of six-coloured flames, which extends for a hundred leagues all around, which is terrible, scorching,

original: mahānirayā cavamānā maccuno bhāyantī”ti?
analyzed: mahānirayā cavamānāḥ maccunaḥ bhāyanti iti
translated: and which, as it is breaking up, is frightening to Death?”

original: “Āma, mahārājā”ti.
analyzed: āma mahārāja ati
translated: “Yes, Great King.”

original: “Nanu, bhante nāgasena, nirayo ekantadukkhavedanīyo, kissa pana te nerayikā sattā ekantadukkhavedanīyā nirayā cavamānā maccuno bhāyanti, kissa niraye ramantī”ti?
analyzed: nanu bhante nāgasena nirayaḥ ekanta dukkha vedanīyo kissa pana te nerayikāḥ sattāḥ ekanta dukkha vedanīyāḥ nirayā cavamānāḥ maccunaḥ bhāyanti kissa niraye ramanti iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, is not the hell a place of suffering? Why then, as the beings in hell are breaking up, are they frightened of Death? Why do they delight in hell?”

original: “Na te, mahārāja, nerayikā sattā niraye ramanti, muñcitukāmāva te nirayā.
analyzed: na te mahā rāja nerayikāḥ sattāḥ niraye ramanti muñcitu kāmāḥ te nirayāḥ
translated: “Great King, the beings in hell do not delight in hell, they are anxious to escape from it.

original: Maraṇasseva so, mahārāja, ānubhāvo, yena tesaṁ santāso uppajjatī”ti.
analyzed: maraṇassa iva saḥ mahā rāja ānubhāvaḥ yena tesam santāsaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: It is the power of Death, sire, by which fear arises in them.”

original: “Etaṁ kho, bhante nāgasena, na saddahāmi, yaṁ muccitukāmānaṁ cutiyā santāso uppajjatīti,
analyzed: etam kho bhante nāgasena na saddahāmi yam muccitu kāmānam cutiyā santāsaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, I do not believe that fear arises in those who are anxious to escape from death.

original: hāsanīyaṁ, bhante nāgasena, taṁ ṭhānaṁ, yaṁ te patthitaṁ labhanti, kāraṇena maṁ saññāpehī”ti.
analyzed: hāsanīya bhante nāgasena tam yam te patthitam labhanti kāraṇena mama saññāpehi iti
translated: It is a laughable thing, revered Nāgasena, that they should get what they desire. Convince me by reason.”

original: “Maraṇanti kho, mahārāja, etaṁ adiṭṭhasaccānaṁ tāsanīyaṭṭhānaṁ, etthāyaṁ jano tasati ca ubbijjati ca.
analyzed: kho mahā rāja etam tāsanīya ṭṭhāne ettha ayam janaḥ tasati ca ubbijjati ca
translated: “Death, sire, is a place of terror for those who have not seen the Truth. Herein people are terrified and frightened.

original: Yo ca, mahārāja, kaṇhasappassa bhāyati, so maraṇassa bhāyanto kaṇhasappassa bhāyati.
analyzed: yaḥ ca mahā rāja kaṇha sappassa bhāyati saḥ maraṇassa bhāyantaḥ kaṇha sappassa bhāyati
translated: “He who is afraid of the black snake, sire, is afraid of death when he is afraid of the black snake.

original: Yo ca hatthissa bhāyati …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca hatthissa bhāyati pe
translated: He who is afraid of the elephant …

original: sīhassa … byagghassa … dīpissa … acchassa … taracchassa … mahiṁsassa … gavayassa … aggissa … udakassa … khāṇukassa … kaṇṭakassa bhāyati.
analyzed: sīhassa byagghassa dīpissa acchassa taracchassa mahisassa gavayassa aggissa udakassa khāṇukassa kaṇṭakassa bhāyati
translated: of the lion … of the tiger … of the leopard … of the bear … of the hyena … of fire … of water … of a stump … of a thorn …

original: Yo ca sattiyā bhāyati, so maraṇassa bhāyanto sattiyā bhāyati.
analyzed: yaḥ ca sattiyā bhāyati saḥ maraṇassa bhāyantaḥ sattiyā bhāyati
translated: he who is afraid of the sword, sire, is afraid of death when he is afraid of the sword.

original: Maraṇasseva so, mahārāja, sarasasabhāvatejo, tassa sarasasabhāvatejena sakilesā sattā
analyzed: maraṇassa iva saḥ mahā rāja sa rasa sabhāva tejaḥ tassa sa rasa sabhāva tejena sa kilesā sattā
translated: It is the essence, the nature, the power of death, sire, that the beings who are subject to corruption

original: maraṇassa tasanti bhāyanti, muccitukāmāpi, mahārāja, nerayikā sattā maraṇassa tasanti bhāyanti.
analyzed: maraṇassa tasanti bhāyanti muccitu kāmāḥ api mahā rāja nerayikāḥ sattāḥ maraṇassa tasanti bhāyanti
translated: are terrified and frightened of death. Even those beings, sire, who are in hell and who desire to be freed are terrified and frightened of death.

original: Idha, mahārāja, purisassa kāye medo gaṇṭhi uppajjeyya.
analyzed: idha mahā rāja purisassa kāye medaḥ gaṇṭhi uppajjeyya
translated: Here, sire, a boil might arise on a man’s body.

original: So tena rogena dukkhito upaddavā parimuccitukāmo bhisakkaṁ sallakattaṁ āmantāpeyya.
analyzed: saḥ tena rogena dukkhitaḥ upaddavā parimuccitu kāmaḥ bhisakkam sallakattam āmantāpeyya
translated: He, being afflicted with that disease, desiring to be freed from the danger, would summon a physician.

original: Tassa vacanaṁ so bhisakko sallakatto sampaṭicchitvā tassa rogassa uddharaṇāya upakaraṇaṁ
analyzed: tassa vacanam saḥ bhisakkaḥ sallakatto sampaṭicchitvā tassa rogassa uddharaṇāya upakaraṇa
translated: The physician, having agreed to the words of that man, would prepare a remedy for the removal of his disease,

original: upaṭṭhāpeyya, satthakaṁ tikhiṇaṁ kareyya, yamakasalākā aggimhi pakkhipeyya, khāralavaṇaṁ
analyzed: upaṭṭhāpeyya satthakam tikhiṇam kareyya yamaka salākāḥ aggimhi pakkhipeyya khāra lavaṇa
translated: he would sharpen a sharp knife, he would put double-pointed sticks on the fire, he would pound coarse salt in a mortar,

original: nisadāya pisāpeyya, api nu kho, mahārāja, tassa āturassa tikhiṇasatthakacchedanena
analyzed: nisadāya pisāpeyya api nu kho mahā rāja tassa āturassa tikhiṇa satthaka chedanena
translated: would a terror arise in that sick man, great king, by the cutting with the sharp knife,

original: yamakasalākādahanena khāraloṇappavesanena tāso uppajjeyyā”ti?
analyzed: yamaka salākā dahanena khāra loṇa ppavesanena tāsaḥ uppajjeyya ati
translated: by the burning with the double-pointed sticks, by the pouring in of the coarse salt?”

original: “Āma, bhante”ti.
analyzed: āma bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, reverend Sir.”

original: “Iti, mahārāja, tassa āturassa rogā muccitukāmassāpi vedanābhayā santāso uppajjati.
analyzed: iti mahā rāja tassa āturassa rogāḥ muccitu kāmassa api vedanā bhayā santāsaḥ uppajjati
translated: “So, great king, for that sick man, who desires to be freed from his disease, a terror arises because of the pain.

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, nirayā muccitukāmānampi nerayikānaṁ sattānaṁ maraṇabhayā santāso uppajjati.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja nirayāḥ muccitu kāmānam pi nerayikānam sattānam maraṇa bhayā santāsaḥ uppajjati
translated: In the same way, great king, for the beings in hell, who desire to be freed from hell, a terror arises because of the fear of death.

original: Idha, mahārāja, puriso issarāparādhiko baddho saṅkhalikabandhanena gabbhe pakkhitto parimuccitukāmo assa, tamenaṁ so issaro mocetukāmo pakkosāpeyya.
analyzed: idha mahā rāja purisaḥ issara apara adhikaḥ baddhaḥ saṅkhalika bandhanena gabbhe pakkhittaḥ parimuccitu kāmaḥ assa tam enam saḥ issaraḥ mocetu kāmaḥ pakkosāpeyya
translated: Here, sire, a man who has offended the king is bound with fetters and chains and thrown into prison, and he is desirous of being released. Then the king, being desirous of releasing him, summons him.

original: Api nu kho, mahārāja, tassa issarāparādhikassa purisassa ‘katadoso ahan’ti jānantassa issaradassanena santāso uppajjeyyā”ti?
analyzed: api nu kho mahā rāja tassa issara apara adhikassa purisassa kata dosaḥ ahanti jānantassa issara dassanena santāsaḥ uppajjeyya ati
translated: Now, sire, would terror arise in that man who has offended the king, knowing that he has offended, when he sees the king?”

original: “Āma, bhante”ti.
analyzed: āma bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, revered sir.”

original: “Iti, mahārāja, tassa issarāparādhikassa purisassa parimuccitukāmassāpi issarabhayā santāso uppajjati.
analyzed: iti mahā rāja tassa issara apara adhikassa purisassa parimuccitu kāmassa api issara bhayā santāsaḥ uppajjati
translated: “Thus, sire, terror arises in that man who has offended the king, even though he is desirous of being released, because of his fear of the king.

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, nirayā muccitukāmānampi nerayikānaṁ sattānaṁ maraṇabhayā santāso uppajjatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja nirayāḥ muccitu kāmānam pi nerayikānam sattānam maraṇa bhayā santāsaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: Even so, sire, terror arises in the beings in hell, who are desirous of being released from hell, because of their fear of death.”

original: “Aparampi, bhante, uttariṁ kāraṇaṁ brūhi, yenāhaṁ kāraṇena okappeyyan”ti.
analyzed: aparam pi bhante uttarim kāraṇam brūhi yena aham kāraṇena okappeyyanti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, give me yet another reason for this, so that I may be convinced.”

original: “Idha, mahārāja, puriso daṭṭhavisena āsīvisena daṭṭho bhaveyya, so tena visavikārena
analyzed: mahā rāja purisaḥ daṭṭha visena āsīvisena daṭṭhaḥ bhaveyya saḥ tena visa vikārena
translated: “Here, sire, a man might be bitten by a poisonous snake. He would be affected by the poison of the snake.

analyzed: pateyya uppateyya vaṭṭeyya pavaṭṭeyya athaññataraḥ puriso balavantena manta padena  tam daṭṭha visam āsīvisam ānetvā tam daṭṭha visam paccācamāpeyya api nu kho mahā rāja
translated: would jump up, would jump down, would jump out, would jump back, then another man, with a powerful spell,

original: tassa visagatassa purisassa tasmiṁ daṭṭhavise sappe sotthihetu upagacchante santāso uppajjeyyā”ti?
analyzed: tassa visa gatassa purisassa tasmin daṭṭha vise sappe sotthi hetu upagacchante santāsaḥ uppajjeyyāti
translated: would bring that snake, which was a deadly poisonous snake, and would make it bite that snake, which was a deadly poisonous snake. Would fear arise in that man, who was poisoned, on account of the safety of that snake, which was a deadly poisonous snake?”

original: “Āma, bhante”ti.
analyzed: āma bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, revered sir.”

original: “Iti, mahārāja, tathārūpe ahimhi sotthihetupi upagacchante tassa santāso uppajjati.
analyzed: iti mahā rāja tathārūpe ahimhi upagacchante tassa santāsaḥ uppajjati
translated: “Thus, sire, fear arises in him on account of the safety of that snake, though it is going to safety.

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, nirayā muccitukāmānampi nerayikānaṁ sattānaṁ maraṇabhayā santāso uppajjati.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja nirayāḥ muccitu kāmānam pi nerayikānam sattānam maraṇa bhayā santāsaḥ uppajjati
translated: Even so, sire, fear arises in the beings in hell on account of the danger of death, though they are desirous of being freed from hell.

original: Aniṭṭhaṁ, mahārāja, sabbasattānaṁ maraṇaṁ, tasmā nerayikā sattā nirayā parimuccitukāmāpi maccuno bhāyantī”ti.
analyzed: aniṭṭha mahā rāja sabba sattānam maraṇa tasmā nerayikā sattā nirayā parimuccitu kāmā api maccunaḥ bhāyanti iti
translated: Death, sire, is unpleasant to all beings, and therefore the beings in hell, though desirous of being freed from hell, fear death.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “It is good, revered Nāgasena, so it is, therefore do I accept it.”

original: Maccubhāyanābhāyanapañho tatiyo.
analyzed: maccubhāyanābhāyanapañho tatiyo
translated: The third question concerning fear of death is concluded.
